def_cn: 远;遥远地
def_en: If one place, thing, or person is far away from another, there is a great distance between them.

def_cn: (用于问及距离或位置)有多远，远至
def_en: If you ask how far a place is, you are asking what distance it is from you or from another place. If you ask how far someone went, you are asking what distance they travelled, or what place they reached.

def_cn: (同一处的两物)离得较远的，那一边的
def_en: When there are two things of the same kind in a place, the far one is the one that is a greater distance from you.

def_cn: (某个方向上)最远的，最…端的
def_en: You can use far to refer to the part of an area or object that is the greatest distance from the centre in a particular direction. For example, the far north of a country is the part of it that is the greatest distance to the north.

def_cn: (时间或事件)久，远
def_en: A time or event that is far away in the future or the past is a long time from the present or from a particular point in time.

def_cn: (用于谈及程度或范围)到…程度(或范围)
def_en: You can use far to talk about the extent or degree to which something happens or is true.

def_cn: (用于谈及进展)到…程度，到…阶段
def_en: You can talk about how far someone or something gets to describe the progress that they make.

def_cn: (用于谈论行为)过分到，过分得
def_en: You can talk about how far a person or action goes to describe the degree to which someone's behaviour or actions are extreme.

def_cn: (用于表示在多大程度上赞成)我可不那样认为/我这样认为
def_en: You can use far in expressions like 'I wouldn't go that far' and 'I would go so far' to indicate to what extent you agree with something.

def_cn: (比较时用作强调)…得多，非常，太
def_en: You can use far to mean 'very much' when you are comparing two things and emphasizing the difference between them. For example, you can say that something is far better or far worse than something else to indicate that it is very much better or worse. You can also say that something is, for example, far too big to indicate that it is very much too big.

def_cn: (政治观点)极端的，偏激的
def_en: You can describe people with extreme left-wing or right-wing political views as the far left or the far right.

def_cn: (用于表示不太确信)据我所知/就我记得的
def_en: You can use far in expressions like 'as far as I know' and 'so far as I remember' to indicate that you are not absolutely sure of the statement you are about to make or have just made, and you may be wrong.

def_cn: (比较时用作强调)显然,…得多，大大地
def_en: You use the expression far and away when you are comparing something or someone with others of the same kind, in order to emphasize how great the difference is between them. For example, you can say that something is far and away the best to indicate that it is definitely the best.

def_cn: (比较时用作强调)显然,…得多，大大地
def_en: You use the expression by far when you are comparing something or someone with others of the same kind, in order to emphasize how great the difference is between them. For example, you can say that something is by far the best or the best by far to indicate that it is definitely the best.

def_cn: 根本不;远远不
def_en: If you say that something is far from a particular thing or far from being the case, you are emphasizing that it is not that particular thing or not at all the case, especially when people expect or assume that it is.

def_cn: (用于加强否定)远非如此，绝非这样
def_en: You can use the expression 'far from it' to emphasize a negative statement that you have just made.

def_cn: (表示委婉地反对或批评)不是我要，不是我想
def_en: You say far be it from me to disagree, or far be it from me to criticize, when you are disagreeing or criticizing and you want to appear less hostile.

def_cn: 在一定程度上，在有限程度上(不错或正确)
def_en: If you say that something is good as far as it goes or true so far as it goes, you mean that it is good or true only to a limited extent.

def_cn: 前程远大;很有前途
def_en: If you say that someone will go far, you mean that they will be very successful in their career.

def_cn: 病入膏肓的;无可救药的;积重难返的
def_en: Someone or something that is far gone is in such a bad state or condition that not much can be done to help or improve them.

def_cn: 几近正确;相差无几;仅差毫厘
def_en: Someone or something that is not far wrong ,not far out, or not far off is almost correct or almost accurate.

def_cn: 就我看来;依我之见
def_en: You can use the expression 'as far as I can see' when you are about to state your opinion of a situation, or have just stated it, to indicate that it is your personal opinion.

def_cn: (只能到)如此程度，这个地步
def_en: If you say that something only goes so far or can only go so far, you mean that its extent, effect, or influence is limited.

def_cn: 迄今为止;到目前为止
def_en: If you tell or ask someone what has happened so far, you are telling or asking them what has happened up until the present point in a situation or story, and often implying that something different might happen later.

def_cn: 目前情况良好;现在还算不错
def_en: You can say so far so good to express satisfaction with the way that a situation or activity is progressing, developing, or happening.

def_cn: (故事)说到这儿;(情势)到这一刻
def_en: Thus far means up until the present point in a situation or story.

def_cn: 四面八方;五湖四海
def_en: If people come from far and wide, they come from a large number of places, some of them far away. If things spread far and wide, they spread over a very large area or distance.

def_cn: 差不多;八九不离十
def_en: If you say that someone won't go far wrong or can't go far wrong with a particular thing or course of action, you mean that it is likely to be successful or satisfactory.
as far as I am concerned→see: concern;  a far cry from→see: cry;  in so far as→see: insofar as;  near and far→see: near;
